about.name: Stockholm
about.info_text: Stockholm, the capital of Sweden, is a city spread across 14 islands and known for its stunning architecture, rich history, and beautiful waterways. Visitors can explore the historic Gamla Stan (Old Town), marvel at the Royal Palace, and enjoy cultural attractions like the Vasa Museum and ABBA The Museum. Stockholm offers a mix of modern design, historic charm, and a thriving culinary scene that includes Swedish delicacies and international cuisine.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 975,000
Country: Sweden
Time Zone: Central European Time (CET, UTC+01:00)
Language: Swedish, English
Currency: Swedish Krona (SEK)
about.climate_text: Stockholm has a temperate oceanic climate with cool winters and mild summers. Average temperatures range from -3°C (26°F) in winter to 22°C (72°F) in summer.

attractions_card.title: Gamla Stan (Old Town)
attractions_card.description: Gamla Stan is the historic heart of Stockholm, known for its narrow cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, and historic sites like the Royal Palace.

attractions_card.title: Vasa Museum
attractions_card.description: The Vasa Museum is home to the Vasa warship, a perfectly preserved 17th-century ship that sank on its maiden voyage.

attractions_card.title: ABBA The Museum
attractions_card.description: ABBA The Museum is a tribute to the iconic Swedish pop group, allowing visitors to explore their music history and even sing along.

attractions_card.title: Skansen Open-Air Museum
attractions_card.description: Skansen is an open-air museum showcasing Swedish history, culture, and wildlife. It's a great place to learn about Sweden's heritage.

attractions_card.title: Djurgarden Island
attractions_card.description: Djurgarden is an island featuring numerous attractions, including Gröna Lund amusement park and the Rosendals Garden.

attractions_card.title: Royal Palace
attractions_card.description: The Royal Palace (Kungliga Slottet) is the official residence of the Swedish monarch and a beautiful architectural landmark.

attractions_card.title: Fotografiska (Photography Museum)
attractions_card.description: Fotografiska is a contemporary photography museum featuring a diverse range of photographic art.

attractions_card.title: Drottningholm Palace
attractions_card.description: Drottningholm Palace is a UNESCO World Heritage Site with a stunning palace, beautiful gardens, and a royal theater.

food_card.title: Swedish Meatballs
food_card.description: Swedish meatballs are a classic dish made of seasoned ground meat, often served with lingonberry sauce and potatoes.

food_card.title: Herring
food_card.description: Herring is a traditional Swedish delicacy, available in various pickled and flavored forms.

food_card.title: Smorgastarta (Swedish Sandwich Cake)
food_card.description: Smorgastarta is a unique Swedish dish that resembles a savory sandwich cake, often served on special occasions.

food_card.title: Crayfish Party
food_card.description: Crayfish parties are a traditional Swedish summer event where crayfish is enjoyed along with other dishes and schnapps.

food_card.title: Prinsesstarta (Princess Cake)
food_card.description: Prinsesstarta is a delightful Swedish dessert cake made of layers of sponge cake, cream, and a green marzipan cover.

hotels_card.title: Grand Hotel Stockholm
hotels_card.description: The Grand Hotel Stockholm is a luxurious and historic hotel located on the waterfront, offering elegant rooms and fine dining.

hotels_card.title: Nobis Hotel
hotels_card.description: Nobis Hotel is a stylish and contemporary hotel in the city center, featuring modern design and comfortable accommodations.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Skeppsholmen
hotels_card.description: Hotel Skeppsholmen is a peaceful and eco-friendly hotel on an island, providing a tranquil urban escape.

hotels_card.title: Budget Accommodations
hotels_card.description: Stockholm offers budget-friendly accommodations, including hostels and guesthouses, for cost-conscious travelers.

hotels_card.title: Vacation Rentals
hotels_card.description: Consider vacation rentals or apartments for a more independent and home-like stay in Stockholm.

transport_card.title: Arlanda Airport
transport_card.description: Arlanda Airport (ARN) is the primary international gateway to Stockholm, located about 40 kilometers north of the city center.

transport_card.title: Stockholm Public Transport
transport_card.description: Stockholm offers an efficient public transport system, including buses, trams, and the Tunnelbana (metro) to navigate the city.

transport_card.title: Ferries and Water Taxis
transport_card.description: Explore the city's archipelago and waterways with ferries and water taxis that connect various islands and districts.

transport_card.title: Walking and Biking
transport_card.description: Walking and biking are excellent ways to explore Stockholm, especially in the pedestrian-friendly city center.

transport_card.title: Taxis and Ride-Sharing
transport_card.description: Taxis and ride-sharing services like Uber are readily available for convenient point-to-point transportation.
